actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 17, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Wied moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mrs. McIver asked unanimous consent that she may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 1361, a bill originally introduced by Representative Payne, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.

Mrs. McIver asked unanimous consent that she may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 1765, a bill originally introduced by Representative Payne, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 348
actions-list.actionItem: 39, 5 Present (Roll no. 505).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 4077 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 180 Steuart Street in San Francisco, California, as the "Dianne Feinstein Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 382
actions-list.actionItem: 12 (Roll no. 504).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 141 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve certain programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs for home and community based services for veterans, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 390
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 503).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3998 — "To provide for the permanent appointment of certain temporary district judgeships."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 374
actions-list.actionItem: 15 (Roll no. 502).
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4077.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Foxx moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4077 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 180 Steuart Street in San Francisco, California, as the "Dianne Feinstein Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 59.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 59 — "To implement merit-based reforms to the civil service hiring system that replace degree-based hiring with skills- and competency-based hiring."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3946.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3946 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1106 Main Street in Bastrop, Texas, as the "Sergeant Major Billy D. Waugh Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6244.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6244 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1535 East Los Ebanos Boulevard in Brownsville, Texas, as the "1st Lieutenant Andres Zermeno Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9595.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9595 — "To improve Federal technology procurement, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4716.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4716 — "To amend section 7504 of title 31, United States Code, to improve the single audit requirements."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2414.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burlison moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2414 — "To require agencies with working dog programs to implement the recommendations of the Government Accountability Office relating to the health and welfare of working dogs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8150.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gonzales, Tony moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8150 — "To require the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to establish procedures for conducting maintenance projects at ports of entry at which the Office of Field Operations conducts certain enforcement and facilitation activities."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2513.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2513 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve benefits administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 141.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 141 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve certain programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs for home and community based services for veterans, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9124.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9124 — "To name the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Auburn, California, as the "Louis A. Conter VA Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8667.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8667 — "To rename the community-based outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Cadillac, Michigan, as the "Duane E. Dewey VA Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4955.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4955 — "To name the community-based outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Monroeville, Pennsylvania, as the "Henry Parham VA Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3938.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3938 — "To designate the community-based outpatient clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Lynchburg, Virginia, as the "Private First Class Desmond T. Doss VA Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5314.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5314 — "To designate the medical center of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Tulsa, Oklahoma, as the James Mountain Inhofe VA Medical Center."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3998.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3998 — "To provide for the permanent appointment of certain temporary district judgeships."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4610.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4610 — "To amend title 36, United States Code, to designate the bald eagle as the national bird."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6020.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6020 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to eliminate consideration of the income of organ recipients in providing reimbursement of expenses to donating individuals, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7188.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7188 — "To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a national, evidence-based education campaign to increase public and health care provider awareness regarding the potential risks and benefits of human cell and tissue products transplants, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4534.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4534 — "To require a review of women and lung cancer, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 223.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 223 — "To amend the Controlled Substances Act to fix a technical error in the definitions."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7224.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bucshon moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7224 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the Stop, Observe, Ask, and Respond to Health and Wellness Training Program."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of the debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7213.
Mr. Bucshon moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3293.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3293 — "To require the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to establish an interagency strike force to ensure that certain Federal land management agencies, including the organizational units of such agencies, prioritize the review of requests for communications use authorizations, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1377.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1377 — "To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to take certain actions to enhance the representation of the United States and promote United States leadership in communications standards-setting bodies, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3343.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3343 — "To require the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to submit to Congress a plan for the Assistant Secretary to track the acceptance, processing, and disposal of certain Form 299s, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6394.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6394 — "To provide for the creation of a Congressional time capsule in commemoration of the semiquincentennial of the United States, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9487.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9487 — "To amend the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1970 to authorize the Legislative Counsel of the House of Representatives to designate more than one of the attorneys of the Office of the Legislative Counsel as a Deputy Legislative Counsel, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9489.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9489 — "To sunset the Advisory Committee on the Records of Congress, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 932.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 932 — "To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for the halt in pension payments for Members of Congress sentenced for certain offenses, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9488.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9488 — "To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require the disclosure of the card verification value as a condition of the acceptance of online contributions made through the use of credit or debit cards in elections for Federal office and to prohibit the acceptance of contributions made through the use of gift cards and prepaid credit cards in such elections, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 13, 2024, at 12:00 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 59, S. 141, S. 2513, S. 2783, S. 2908, S. 4365, S. 4370, S. 5046, and H.R. 8663, with amendments.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 12, 2024, at 3:55 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 920, S. 3857, and S. 4000.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignation of the gentleman from North Dakota, Mr. Armstrong, the whole number of the House is 430.
The House received a communication from Representative Armstrong wherein he resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective at 11:59 p.m. on December 14, 2024.
The Chair designated Mr. Morelle to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rear Admiral Gregory Todd, Chief of Chaplains, United States Navy Washington, DC
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Scott Fitzgerald to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
